snippet: Employees sometimes book out of company policy because the preferred hotel or airline is inconvenient.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column observes employees on business travel sometimes book out of company policy because the preferred hotel or airline is inconvenient; points out his column has long annoyed travel managers by supporting better convenience and comfort for business travelers, even if they do have to go rogue.
lead_paragraph: Employees sometimes book out of company policy because the preferred hotel or airline is inconvenient.

headline.seo: Bending the Company Rules for Business Travel
